Query: How to trim whitespace from a Bash variable?

Top-3 Similar Questions: so_11791402: Shell Script: How to trim spaces from a bash variable
so_1628885: trim junk characters from variable
Top-3 Scripts:
so_11791402: variable="  gfgergj lkjgrg  "
echo $variable | sed 's,^ *,,; s, *$,,'

so_26080719: bash: $(...) trims trailing empty lines. How to properly assign to variable a command's output?
so_26169847: Trimming new line character from a string in bash
Top-3 Scripts:
so_26169847: title=$(dos2unix <"$1" | head -n 1) # grab the first row
echo $title
IFS=',' read -a titline <<<"$title"   # make it an array
for (( i = 0 ; i < ${#titline[@]} ; i++ )) do
    echo "[[${titline[$i]}]]"
done

title=$(head -n 1 "$1" | sed 's/\r//') # grab the first row
echo $title
IFS=',' read -a titline <<<"$title"   # make it an array
for (( i = 0 ; i < ${#titline[@]} ; i++ )) do
    echo "[[${titline[$i]}]]"
done
